name: phpunit-test-workbench
description: An extension to integrate PHPUnit with the native Test Explorer functionality within VS Code, with zero configuration required for common environment setups.

phpunit-test-workbench.log.level.markdownDescription: Set the level of detail for log messages.

phpunit-test-workbench.php.binaryPath.markdownDescription: Path to location of the PHP binary. If left blank, will attempt to use globally available binary.

phpunit-test-workbench.phpunit.binaryPat.markdownDescription:
Path to location of the PHPUnit binary (either `phpunit` or `phpunit.phar`). If left blank, will attempt to find the binary in common locations:
  - Composer vendor directory
  - `phpunit.phar` in the current workspace
  - Globally available `phpunit` (or `phpunit.bat`)

phpunit-test-workbench.phpunit.testOrgan.markdownDescription: Describes the way tests are organised in the Testing panel.

phpunit-test-workbench.phpunit.testNames.markdownDescription: If using PSR-4 namespaces, use this setting to map your test namespace to the test directory. Default is blank (which assumes the folder structure inside your test directory matches the namespace structure exactly).

phpunit-test-workbench.phpunit.useTestSu.markdownDescription: Use test suite definitions in your configuration file to locate and group tests in the Test Explorer. Note that using this option requires the use of a configuration file, and that the 'Test Directory' setting will be ignored.

phpunit-test-workbench.phpunit.locatorPa.markdownDescription: The glob describing the location of your configuration file (usually named `phpunit.xml`). If left blank, PHPUnit will fall back to default behaviour and attempt to find a `phpunit.xml` file in the test directory.

phpunit-test-workbench.phpunit.testDirec.markdownDescription: Relative path from the workspace folder root to the directory where test files are located (usually the `tests` folder). If left blank, the workspace folder root will be used. Multiple paths can be specified, separated by commas (`,`).

phpunit-test-workbench.phpunit.testFileS.markdownDescription: Suffix used to identify test files within the test directory. If left blank, the PHPUnit default suffixes (`Test.php` and `.phpt`) will be used.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
